pros: easy to get a job and do HW
cons: Lot of time to commit and must stay on campus

job_title: Event Manager in Miami Gardens, FL
pros: None. New hires RUN away!
cons: Everything. President is a tyrant. Toxic work environment

job_title: Vice President Marketing and Communication in Miami Gardens, FL
pros: New leadership has truly made a difference in the right direction. STU is on its third year of record enrollment, has added several new sports (including football), opened two new building complexes, and continues to grow in all aspects of the University. There is a renewed sense of purpose, and a drive to make STU the Notre Dame of the South.
cons: Growing pains stemming from the rapid growth and success of academics, student programs, and athletics. Some disgruntled ex-employees that were unwilling to get with the program (the successful program, if I may add) are leaving bad reviews all over social media. Do not listen. Look at the data, the students, the campus excitement, and the fact that STU is not only surviving, but thriving.

job_title: Director in Miami Gardens, FL
pros: Absolutely nothing positive to say about this institution. I really felt bad for the students paying full tuition for the education they receive here.
cons: Very toxic work environment where you fear for your job every day. No leadership whatsoever, nepotism, no performance reviews, no upward movement.

job_title: Director of Human Resources in Miami, FL
pros: Small University, truly allows the opportunity to make a difference with the students. Great Work-Life Balance.
cons: Very Very High Turnover. The administration is misguided and lead by fear. So sad that I have seen some of the best colleagues come and go with no remorse. No one ever receives a performance review. The more you hide in the background the safer you are, if you try to stand up and perform you are quickly taken out.

job_title: Administrative in Miami Gardens, FL
pros: None anymore. The vacation/holiday/sick used to be great, but management has changed the policies.
cons:
The university’s name should appear as the definition of nepotism in the dictionary. The president (David Armstrong) has filled senior management/cabinet and athletics with all his friends from KY/OH. 

Terrible employee morale. Faculty & staff are walking on eggshells. Employees are quitting or getting fired at alarming rates. The salaries are laughably low for anyone not part of the president’s inner circle. 

Student retention and graduation rates are not good at all. Enrollment numbers are inflated.

The quality of the courses is a joke. New programs have been created on a whim and to benefit the president and his friends (Ethical Leadership Institute, Fashion Merchandising.)

job_title: Staff Member in Miami, FL
pros: Some students care - you must seek them out and nurture them.
cons: Hostile work environment, unethical behavior and actions by administrators, employees are all walking on eggshells. The current trajectory of the university is a downward spiral as they lower admissions standards for the sole purpose of boosting enrollment at all cost. Student and staff retention is abysmal. Good people are getting fired or resigning, bad employees are staying. Tyranical leadership with rampant nepotism in leadership. All admin are prior contacts of the President's from Kentucky/Ohio/Pennsylvania. If you hold strong values regarding your educational philosophies and moral compass, avoid this place like the plague. Also note that the university is currently under sanction/probation by its accreditors (SACSCOC).

job_title: Head Softball Coach in Miami, FL
pros: The University is growing in the right direction as a business. Lots of new buildings are being added to accommodate the growth of its students population.
cons: Can be quick to let go of its employees. You work 365 24-7

job_title: Coach in Miami Gardens, FL
pros: People are very nice on campus
cons: A lot of changes occuring

review_title: Okayy for a job while in college
job_title: Work Study Student in Miami, FL
pros: Excellent staff and great learning experience! Stress free environment
cons: Pay is really low compared to how much is your tuition.

job_title: Academic Administrator in Miami Gardens, FL
pros: Diversity of staff and their dedication to students
cons: Unethical Senior Leadership is Pervasive

review_title: It is what you make of it
job_title: Academic Success Fellow in Miami Gardens, FL
pros: Nothing was deducted from my paycheck, which helps when you are a student--quick money. We made our own hours and could work as much or as little as we wanted.
cons: Not really a transferrable skill to put on your resume once you enter the field. Maybe capitalize on the fact that you were /paid/ because of your academic skills? Even so . . . after a year following graduation, it's not necessarily something I can keep on my resume.

job_title: Adjunct Professor in Miami, FL
pros: People that work there are nice. Supervisors are supportive.
cons: Hard to get more classes.

job_title: Executive Director in North Miami, FL
pros: The campus is safe and pretty
cons: Terrible leadership under President Armstrong. He fired too many good people, kept a lot of incompetent ones, and then fired them too. The man is a bull in a china shop. Finances are terrible and they have been put on probation by SACSCOC, regional accreditors. Academic and admission standards have been lower and faculty is very unhappy. Terrible place to work.

job_title: Athletics in Miami Gardens, FL
pros: Growth at the University is outstanding
cons: Facilities and food on campus, improvements to women's sports

review_title: Great place to work while being a student
job_title: Research Assistant in Miami Gardens, FL
pros: It is a great place to work while attending the law school. Very flexible and understanding
cons: Some of the research can be difficult but very open door policy and everyone is willing to help

job_title: Director in Miami Gardens, FL
pros: This used to be a great workplace, good school, great campus, great students and some good faculty.
cons: Unfortunately in 2008 a tyrant leadership took over. A lot of nepotism and undeserving promotions took place. Anybody before this administration got replaced with their incompetent counterparts. A lot of irresponsible fiscal spending put the school in bad financial standing.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Miami Gardens, FL
pros: It's a beautiful campus. There are some very nice people there.
cons:
Nepotism was rampant - if someone important wanted somebody hired, they would be hired, even if they were incompetent or volatile, and they would likely never be dismissed.

Some incompetent, lazy, or downright rude employees are allowed to stick around forever, while other employees are let go apparently at random. A lot of major management decisions seemed to be based on the whims of the moment, with little planning or oversight, and no recourse for those affected.

No staff members I spoke with had had a raise in years.

Communication, at least in my department was poor; there was a lot of side-talk, but very little direct communication or consistent disciplinary procedure.

Also, since STU is a Catholic institution, contraception is not covered by the health insurance - and benefits are not extended to same-sex spouses.

job_title: in Miami Gardens, FL
pros: Welcoming campus. The people are really nice. Family like atmosphere. Sense of community. Great work-life balance. Lots of holidays and almost 2 weeks off during Christmas time. Free gym membership.
cons: Very siloed culture. Lack of cooperation and teamwork between units. No room for career growth and development. Small budgets. Raises are rare and far between. Salaries very low to begin with. Technology is not up to date.

job_title: Summer Research Assistant in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Flexible work schedule, understanding supervisors, helpful coworkers, and an overall relaxed and enjoyably low-key work environment.
cons: Poor pay, somewhat long hours depending on your role with the lab, a lot of documentation, little praise.  Had an issue with the University messing up my direct deposit a few times, but resolved it with my own action.

job_title: Software Developer/Web Developer in Sunnyvale, CA
pros: Calm work environment. Very nice, comfortable setting within university area, surrounded by lush vegetation from the Miami Gardens area. Free access to university library and gym.
cons: There aren't downsides to working here. If you are looking for a peaceful work environment in a middle-sized university that has a fair to moderate amount of work, then I would suggest applying here. Otherwise, a candidate might want to look elsewhere.

review_title: Average place, tight with money, lots of nepotism, not much chance for advancement.
job_title: Library in Miami Gardens, FL
pros: Very hard to get fired. Not too much expected of you. You can probably stay there for a long time, but you won't get much out of it.
cons: Not in a good neighborhood. Irregular raises and when you do it is at a low percent. Lots of upper management/administration problems that do not get addressed. You would think that a perk would be to get a free education, but the choices are very limited and the options to take classes are limited as well.

review_title: Satisfied with time of employment and wonderful environment.
job_title: in Miami Gardens, FL
pros: Education, work ethic, and charming school.  The other employees are well versed in their respective specialties and that makes for a positive working environment.
cons: The pay is pretty decent and management is alright, but the departments need to become more synchronized.  The school provides plenty of opportunities to become involved.

job_title: Assistant Professor in Miami Gardens, FL
pros: Not many faculty left, but those who remain are nice and dedicated. Campus is pretty.
cons: President, Provost, HR and admin staff are horrible. Staff and faculty compare it to the Hunger Games or working at a concentration camp and both are apt descriptions. They treat faculty worse than animals and have zero respect for teaching. They see the students as customers and run the place like a for profit business that is failing. Stay away if you have integrity and self respect.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Thomas, MN
pros: Dedicated staff, very professional institution overall
cons: Conservative  culture, more reserved students and staff

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Miami Lakes, FL
pros: Great values, awesome team of professionals. The entire staff and administration shows they care for you. The place is an oasis. You are surrounded by palm trees, perfect weather year round. The faculty is also really amazing to work with.
cons: Limited by budget and slow to adopt technology.

review_title: Lots of Potential, Lacking in Qualified Leadership
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Miami Gardens, FL
pros: Beautiful campus, good benefits, free education for employees and dependents.
cons: Currently, clueless leadership.  In need of a shake-up at the top.

job_title: in Miami Gardens, FL
pros: The people working here are generally nice, helpful, and easy going.  The jobs have reasonable hours and there is a fair mount of flexibility.
cons: The location is some what far for where many people live.  The graduate assistant position has limited options as to where the graduate assistants can work.

job_title: Manager in Miami, FL
pros: Fantastic and warm rank and file staff/faculty. Beautiful campus. Diverse students.
cons: Staff are fearful of being fired almost every day they come to work. Seriously. The new administration is getting bloated with  upper management brought from the new President's previous Kentucky/Ohio/Penn contacts.  Faculty and staff morale could not get worse.

job_title: Adjunct Lecturer in Miami, FL
pros: You are paid additional stipend for being on committee's and a bonus for each student who graduates. Online courses are typically 7 weeks.
cons: $2k per class for 7 weeks is not much compared to other institutions.

job_title: Systems Administrator in Miami Gardens, FL
pros: The people, culture, activities, the job itself....all these were reasons I stayed working there for so long.
cons: Highly underpaid. Would have stayed there if it weren't for that.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Miami Gardens, FL
pros: Familial environment, structured department, great students
